abstract: Takeovers are the logical next step, but the challenge, writes John Foley of Reuters Breakingviews, is not to make the same mistakes as Japan did in the 1980s.
snippet: Takeovers are the logical next step, but the challenge, writes John Foley of Reuters Breakingviews, is not to make the same mistakes as Japan did in the 1980s.
lead_paragraph: China’s banks are racking up foreign assets, driven by trade flows, and the country’s corporate diaspora. Even at the current slow pace, what today looks like “following the client” could soon become “following everyone’s clients.” (See chart.)

headline.main: China’s Banks Are on the Rise
